originalText.text:
I came in as a trans fem person with pelvic pain and Riva did an amazing job of working me through what tools and breathing can help with relaxation and taking pressure off my prostate!

She is highly professional and respectful and on point!

text.text:

She is highly professional and respectful and on point!

originalText.text: I wish I had found Riva immediately after my first c-section. She was so patient, warm, and the first person (after many attempts at PT) to help me actually be pain free around my scar. I can now run, swim and lift my heavy toddlers without paint. AND, best of all, I don't have issues when coughing and peeing. I wish all birthing people were immediately scheduled with Riva!

text.text: I wish I had found Riva immediately after my first c-section. She was so patient, warm, and the first person (after many attempts at PT) to help me actually be pain free around my scar. I can now run, swim and lift my heavy toddlers without paint. AND, best of all, I don't have issues when coughing and peeing. I wish all birthing people were immediately scheduled with Riva!

originalText.text: Riva has been an absolute life saver for me. A long and frustrating road after my hysterectomy had left me at a low ebb physically & emotionally. Then a prominent pelvic pain MD recommended I work with Riva.  I will forever be thankful for Riva’s skill,  professionalism, excellent communication, & ability to put me at ease while guiding me on the road to recovery. She is so intelligent and clearly cares about her patients, recommending complementary practitioners she trusts to ensure you are successful with anything you are dealing with. In addition, Riva is just a kind and fun person, making spending time with her a joy!

originalText.text: Dr. Riva Preil was excellent. She dealt with my issues with sensitivity and explained what was going on and how it can improve. She’s very knowledgeable and is very positive. Highly recommended for bladder/pelvic floor issues.

text.text: Dr. Riva Preil was excellent. She dealt with my issues with sensitivity and explained what was going on and how it can improve. She’s very knowledgeable and is very positive. Highly recommended for bladder/pelvic floor issues.

originalText.text:
Riva is approachable, knowledgeable, affirming, and worth every penny!

I recently had an initial consult while pregnant with my second child. Just wanted to make sure I was taking care of my pelvic floor during pregnancy and wondering if I had any lingering issues from my first birthing experience.

It was clear that Riva had read my intake survey and asked tailored questions to get a clear picture of what I needed. She paused regularly to give me time to ask questions.

After talking for a while, she ran me through a pelvic floor anatomy and physiology lesson that even I could understand! She then summarized the plan for the rest of our session: flexibility exam, internal exam, a lesson on diaphragmatic breathing, c section scar massage and lesson, and a lumbar exam.

At every step of the process, Riva made sure I was comfortable, she engaged in just the right amount of chit chat, she educated and coached me, and she provided reasons for what she was doing. She offered suggestions for at-home care and followed up that night with a series of emails to guide me through my home practice.

What I especially appreciated about Riva is that she did not recommend a follow-up appointment prior to giving birth, meaning she wasn’t just looking for reasons to get more money from me. That really earned my trust, and I look forward to making her services part of my postpartum care! Couldn’t recommend her more!
